<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_init_page_sizes:
```c
static int metal_init_page_sizes(void)
{
	const int max_sizes = MAX_PAGE_SIZES - 1;
	long sizes[max_sizes];

	/* Determine system page size. */
	sizes[0] = getpagesize();
	if (sizes[0] <= 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to get page size\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	_metal.page_size  = sizes[0];
	_metal.page_shift = metal_log2(sizes[0]);
	metal_add_page_size(_metal.tmp_path, _metal.page_shift, 0);

#ifdef HAVE_HUGETLBFS_H
#ifndef MAP_HUGE_SHIFT
	/* System does not support multiple huge page sizes. */
	sizes[0] = gethugepagesize();
	if (sizes[0] > 0) {
		metal_add_page_size(hugetlbfs_find_path(),
				    metal_log2(sizes[0]),
				    MAP_HUGETLB);
	}
#else
	if (gethugepagesize() >= 0) {
		int i, count;

		/* System supports multiple huge page sizes. */
		count = gethugepagesizes(sizes, max_sizes);
		for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
			int shift = metal_log2(sizes[i]);

			if ((shift & MAP_HUGE_MASK) != shift)
				continue;
			metal_add_page_size(
				hugetlbfs_find_path_for_size(sizes[i]),
				shift, (MAP_HUGETLB |
				(shift << MAP_HUGE_SHIFT)));
		}
	}
#endif
#endif

	/* Finally sort the resulting array by size. */
	qsort(_metal.page_sizes, _metal.num_page_sizes,
	      sizeof(struct metal_page_size), metal_pagesize_compare);

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
metal_add_page_size(_metal.tmp_path, _metal.page_shift, 0);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: If metal_add_page_size's first parameter is declared as a non-const pointer (e.g. char *path) but the function does not modify the string, then _metal.tmp_path should be a pointer to const (const char *) or the function parameter should be const-qualified. In that case passing _metal.tmp_path as shown violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. (If, however, metal_add_page_size already declares its parameter as const char *, there is no violation.)
